title: Project Organization
text:
Naming Conventions
TL-DR:
Best practices when naming directories and files:

title: Project Organization
text:
Make it machine readable

Use globbing to isolate and find files that match a simple pattern using regular expressions in a scripting language

Eg., The following bash code will find all file names that start with report-2020- and ends with .txt report-2020-*.txt

No spaces or accented characters
No punctuation other than hyphens (-) and underscores (_)
Use lowercase only

Make it human readable

Use highly informative slugs (e.g., 01_collect-cdec-snow-data.R)

Should be descriptive and should accurately reflect the content
Should be concise
Use plain language, but still readable and understandable
Use hyphenation for spaces
Use underscores to separate metadata that needs to be parsed or processed in a scripting language using regular expressions
Avoid special characters


Sort it in a useful way

Put something numeric first
Logical sorting

Apply left padding (e.g., 01, 02, etc.) to single digit numbers in file names to maintain their sequential order
Use when you have a predefined sequence or steps in a process (e.g., stages in a workflow)

Chronological sorting

Follow the ISO 8601 standard when formatting dates: YYYY-MM-DD (e.g., 2020-12-01_draft.docx)
Use when the timeline of creation, modification, or relevance is important (e.g., In projects with regular updates or when you need to track progress or changes over time where the most recent date indicates the latest version)

Create New Project Directory
The following code creates a directory for your project within the current-projects/ directory in the Oleson Lab/ Shared Google Drive by making a copy of an existing template.
To execute this code chunk, please do the following:

Ensure you have Google Drive for Desktop software downloaded, you are signed in, and are able to see the Oleson Lab/ directory in your Shared Drives/ directory
Change #| eval: false to #| eval: true
Input your desired project name in the code project_name="example-project".


```{bash}
#| label: create-new-project-directory
#| code-overflow: wrap
1#| eval: false

2echo "Starting script..."

3cd "/g/Shared drives/Oleson Lab/projects/project-management-resources"

4new_project_template="/g/Shared drives/Oleson Lab/projects/project-management-resources/new-project-template"

project_name="example-project"

5new_current_project_directory="/g/Shared drives/Oleson Lab/projects/current-projects/$project_name"

# Check if the directory already exists
6if [ -d "$new_current_project_directory" ]; then
    echo "Error: A project with the name '$project_name' already exists. Please choose a different name."
    exit 1
fi

# Copy the new-project-template directory to the new project directory
7cp -r "$new_project_template" "$new_current_project_directory"

8echo "Completed copying."
```

7

8
